Sequence Information.Peptide Name: LL-31 (Synthetic AMPs, N-terminal fragment of LL-37, UCLL1; Derivative: D-LL-31)
Sequence Information.Source: Sequence truncation, human cathelicidin analog, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (93.55%) toLL-29. K: 19%; F=L=R: 13%. GRAVY: -0.642; M Wt: 3823.575; M formula: C177H294N50O43, mol ex coeff: 0.Activity: it killed B. thailandensis (MBC 5 uM) (Kanthawong et al., 2010), planktonic and biofilm forms of B. pseudomallei (Kanthawong et al., 2012),  P. aeruginosa, P. gingivalis (D-LL-31).SAR: This peptide corresponds to the structured region of LL-37 bound to lipid micelles (Wang, 2008). UPdated 8/2024
Literature Information.Author: den Hertog AL, van Marle J, Veerman EC, Valentijn-Benz M, Nazmi K, Kalay H, Gr√ºn CH, Van't Hof W, Bolscher JG, Nieuw Amerongen AV. 2006
Literature Information.Title: The human cathelicidin peptide LL-37 and truncated variants induce segregation of lipids and proteins in the plasma membrane of Candida albicans.
